title: Phish - The Man Who Stepped Into Yesterday (1988)
description:
Phish
The Man Who Stepped Into Yesterday

July 1988, the senior thesis of Trey Anastasio
Recorded on 4-track at Goddard College, Plainfield, VT, USA

The Man Who Stepped into Yesterday (often abbreviated as TMWSIY) is a concept album
written by Trey Anastasio, the guitarist and lead vocalist of the American
rock band Phish, as his senior thesis while attending Goddard College.
Composed in 1988, the thesis included an essay piece and a collection of songs
(recorded by Phish) relating an epic tale from the fictional land of Gamehendge.

Based on a 5th generation tape, transferred 11/2007 by Jw603 and uploaded to etree
(at http://bt.etree.org/details.php?id=511177 ), with these additional fixes:

- Increased speed by 2% to correct pitch.
- Flipped an out of phase channel (this error appears on every copy I've seen).
- Fixed many misspelled names and words in song titles and lyrics, based on Trey's
  original written thesis.
- Added embedded artwork from phish.net.
- Included an MP3 copy for convenience.

Two special bonuses:

- A PDF copy of Trey's original written thesis, thanks to Cleantones.

- From the depths of my personal vault, never before seen online, a STEREO copy
of the album. The narration is on the left channel, the music is on the right.
I have no information as to its origin, this is what I received in a tape trade
many years ago. The beginning is cut and the quality is low, but I am including it
here for historical interest.

Enjoy!
